Package game

Class Box

java.lang.Object
game.Box
public class Box extends Object
Represents a single "box" in the game of Dots and Boxes. Conceptually, a box is a collection of four lines that define the boxes boundaries. Each box has a unique upper left coordinate that defines it.

    • claim

      public void claim(Player owner)
      Attempt to claim a box. A box is claimed by an owner when all 4 lines that form the box have been claimed. This is called each time a Line is claimed. The line knows which boxes are associated with it. Based on these assumptions, and the prevention of a line being claimed multiple times, this should only be called exactly 4 times per Box.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owner that claimed the last line.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the label of the boxes owner. Look at the Player enum.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Two boxes are equal if the boxes have the same row, column, owner and 4 lines.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      whether they are equal or not
